Key Match Events: West Indies won by 5 wickets with 6 balls remaining.
West Indies scored 137/5 in 19 overs chasing a target of 137 set by Papua New Guinea who scored 136/8.
Pre-Game Insights: West Indies aimed to start strong and boost their net run-rate.
West Indies came into the World Cup after a 3-0 sweep over South Africa and a win against Australia in a warm-up game.
Andre Russell had a strike rate of 207.89 in T20s this year.
Nicholas Pooran was in fine six-hitting form, having hit 154 sixes since the start of 2023.
PNG had ten members from their 2021 World Cup squad and only four players below 25.
PNG's primary spinner Charles Amini was also a key batter with 994 runs and 47 wickets in T20Is.

West Indies' probable XI included Johnson Charles, Brandon King, Nicholas Pooran, Rovman Powell, Shimron Hetmyer, Sherfane Rutherford, Andre Russell, Akeal Hosein, Alzarri Joseph, Shamar Joseph, and Gudakesh Motie.
PNG's probable XI included Tony Ura, Sese Bau, Assad Vala, Lega Siaka, Charles Amini, Hiri Hiri, Kiplin Doriga, Norman Vanua, Alei Nao, John Kariko, and Chad Soper.
Post-Match Reflections: West Indies captain Rovman Powell expressed high expectations from Andre Russell.
PNG captain Assad Vala emphasized that his team aimed to play their best cricket and not just participate.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The average first-innings score at Providence in T20 games since 2022 is 168.
Spinners have been dominant at Providence with an economy of 6.94.
There were chances of showers and thunderstorms on the match day.
